CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: As shown in this table , when the GPC was measured using polystyrene as the standard , the number - average molecular weights ( M n ) of PQCDTB and PCZDTB were 49.8 and 15.2 kg / mol , respectively.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Material Name" entities:

1. Polystyrene
2. PQCDTB
3. PCZDTB
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

1. Polystyrene
2. PQCDTB
3. PCZDTB

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Polystyrene |
| PQCDTB |
| PCZDTB |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: As shown in this table , when the GPC was measured using polystyrene as the standard , the number - average molecular weights ( M n ) of PQCDTB and PCZDTB were 49.8 and 15.2 kg / mol , respectively.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. GPC (Gel Permeation Chromatography)
2. polystyrene (a standard substance used for comparison)
3. PQCDTB (a polymer with a number-average molecular weight of 49.8 kg/mol)
4. PCZDTB (a polymer with a number-average molecular weight of 15.2 kg/mol)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties:

1. GPC (Gel Permeation Chromatography)
2. polystyrene (a standard substance used for comparison)
3. PQCDTB (a polymer with a number-average molecular weight of 49.8 kg/mol)
4. PCZDTB (a polymer with a number-average molecular weight of 15.2 kg/mol)

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| GPC (Gel Permeation Chromatography) |
| polystyrene (a standard substance used for comparison) |
| PQCDTB (a polymer with a number-average molecular weight of 49.8 kg/mol) |
| PCZDTB (a polymer with a number-average molecular weight of 15.2 kg/mol) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: As shown in this table , when the GPC was measured using polystyrene as the standard , the number - average molecular weights ( M n ) of PQCDTB and PCZDTB were 49.8 and 15.2 kg / mol , respectively.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Property Value" entities:

1. Number-average molecular weight (Mn) - This is the value of the molecular weight of PQCDTB and PCZDTB, which is 49.8 kg/mol and 15.2 kg/mol, respectively.
2. Polystyrene - This is the standard used for measuring the GPC, and its molecular weight is not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph:

1. Number-average molecular weight (Mn) - This is the value of the molecular weight of PQCDTB and PCZDTB, which is 49.8 kg/mol and 15.2 kg/mol, respectively.

I removed the following entities that do not refer to the value of material properties:

* Polystyrene (as it is not a material property)
* GPC (as it is not a material property)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities that refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 49.8 kg/mol (Mn) |
| 15.2 kg/mol |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
